result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Joseph Zurfluh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian Joseph Zurfluh

records.addlTxt: Extending Probation

1:53 PM Defendant Brian Joseph Zurfluh in court.  Other Department of Corrections - Samantha Schneider appeared by video. 
Court reviews file.
Court questions defendant on his failure to pay.  Defendant states he is now in the medical field and is trying to get his child support caught up.  The longer he is in his field, the more he will make but is barely making it by right now.  Agent Schneider makes statement.

BY THE COURT:  Court finds there has not been a good faith effort.  Court will extend probation for an additional year.  If paid, he can be terminated earlier.  If child support is paid off, Court will write off the court costs (not restitution).  Court will review in about 1 year.  Court advises of possible jail time.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.
Probation review hearing on May 17, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

01:15 PM Defendant Brian Joseph Zurfluh appeared by phone means. Attorney Steven James Sarbacker appeared by video means for Defendant Brian Joseph Zurfluh.  
Atty Sarbacker makes statement.  Requests conversion to civil judgment.  Court questions defendant.  Defendant states he has been attempting to get employment.
BY THE COURT:  Court will extend for 1 year and if agent believes a good faith effort has been shown, Court will convert to civil judgment.

records.addlTxt:
10:51 AM Dept. of Corrections appeared by phone means by Marissa Fredrickson. Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brian Joseph Zurfluh in court.
Atty Hendee states defendant has unpaid financial obligations.  BY THE COURT:  Previous warrant is considered satisfied.  Court questions defendant.  Defendant states he is on Extended Supervision until December 2021.  Has no objection to extend this probation.  Ms. Fredrickson states clarified restitution balance of $3803.87.
BY THE COURT:  Court will extend probation for 1 year to June 15, 2020.  Ms. Fredrickson to provide order to Court.
Probation review hearing rescheduled
Probation review hearing on May 30, 2019 at 10:45 am.

10:30 AM Defendant Brian Joseph Zurfluh not in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that that defendant still owes restitution; requests a warrant based on non-appearance and asks that the Probation be extended until the defendant appears in court.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant authorized; Probation will be extended until the defendant appears in court.
Probation review hearing on May 22, 2019 at 10:15 am.

records.addlTxt: Request Denied
to Court from Traci Zurfluh

Defendant Brian Joseph Zurfluh in court.  
Court has reviewed the file and the Revised Restitution Supplement.  Court questions defendant.  Defendant would like to proceed without his counsel here today.  Agrees with the $4800.00 requested by Dean Health Care as shown in the Revised Restitution Supplement.
BY THE COURT:  That amount will be ordered.
Revised 7-18-17 Restitution Supplement
Revised Restitution Supplement=address change
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission
Restitution hearing on July 20, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Brian Joseph Zurfluh in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct 1 to Misd. Battery, contrary to 940.19(1), class A Misd. and also add a Ct 2 of Disorderly Conduct, contrary to 947.01(1), class B Misd.  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Defendant to enter a plea to the amended Ct 1 and to Ct 2.  Joint recommendation for 24 months probtion with conditions.  Atty Sarbacker agrees.
Defendant enters No Contest plea to Cts 1 & 2.   Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Cts 1 & 2.
Sentencing statements by counsel.  Defendant makes statement. 

BY THE COURT:  Ct 1:  Sentence withheld, defendant placed on probation for a period of 24 months with the following conditions:
*Serve 90 days in the Marquette County Jail with huber.  Sentence to commence on or before 8/14/17 by 7:00 p.m., clean and sober.
*Pay costs of $243.00.
*Submit DNA sample and pay $200.00 surcharge.
*Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
*Pay Restitution to Shane Oren in the amount of $594.43 plus the 10% surcharge.  That amount will be taken from bond and the balance of the bond is to be held.  The other portion of restitution to Dean Health Plan will be pending a restitution hearing.
*Granted 97 days credit if probation is revoked.

Ct 2:  Sentence withheld, defendant placed on probation for a period of 24 months with the following conditions:
*Comply with all conditions in Ct 1.
*Pay costs of $243.00.
*Submit DNA sample and pay $200.00 surcharge.  Restitution hearing scheduled for July 20, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Supplement to Dispostion (Restitution)

State files Information.  Defendant received Information and waives it's reading.  Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for return.  Bond continued.

Defendant Brian Joseph Zurfluh in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Defendant Brian Joseph Zurfluh in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives his right to preliminary hearing.  Atty Sarbacker makes statement.  Court questions defendant on his waiver and finds it to be made freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.  Return date scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
